<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
C-SUITE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/05/whats-next-jeff-bezos?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
What's Next for Jeff Bezos?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/05/whats-next-jeff-bezos?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="SEATTLE, WA - JUNE 18: Amazon.com founder and CEO Jeff Bezos presents th..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NjY4L2FtYXpvbl91bnZlaWxzX2l0c19maXJzdC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>David Ryder/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As of yesterday, Jeff Bezos is no longer the CEO of Amazon, the company he founded as an online book retailer in Seattle in 1994. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Bezos left the CEO position as the richest person in the world, having amassed a $199 billion fortune. And though he just bought a $500+ million superyacht, all signs point to him not spending much time on it. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Let’s look at some of Bezos’s side hustles that could become main hustles.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Space</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Bezos’s interest in space <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2018/apr/25/jeff-bezos-the-boy-who-wanted-to-colonise-space?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dates back</a> to his teenage days, when the high school valedictorian told the Miami Herald he wanted to “build space hotels, amusement parks, and colonies for 2 million or 3 million people who would be in orbit.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Fast forward to 2000, when Bezos founded his rocket company Blue Origin two years before Elon Musk would start SpaceX. The amusement park idea may still be decades out, but the company has shorter-term ambitions in space tourism, satellite launches, and lunar landers. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In 2016, Bezos was spending <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/02/03/science/blue-origin-jeff-bezos.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">one day</a> a week working at Blue Origin—expect that to jump.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Philanthropy</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Bezos has pledged $10 billion to climate-focused initiatives through the Bezos Earth Fund and gave $2 billion to increase access to education and address homelessness through the Bezos Day One Fund. But his philanthropic endeavors have been overshadowed by generous donations made by his ex-wife, <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/15/mackenzie-scott-donates-another-27b-bringing-total-almost-9b?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">MacKenzie Scott</a>, and Bezos hasn’t signed the Giving Pledge, a commitment by the ultra-wealthy to give away at least half of their fortune.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The other stuff</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When Mark Cuban sold his audio streaming company to Yahoo for $5.6 billion in 1999, he bought the NBA’s Dallas Mavericks the next year. Will Bezos also buy a sports team? Perhaps—he reportedly has <a href="https://www.cbssports.com/nfl/news/amazon-founder-jeff-bezos-interested-in-owning-nfl-team-has-strong-support-among-current-owners/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">expressed interest</a> in owning an NFL franchise.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When he’s not busy with all of the above, Bezos owns the Washington Post, is building a <a href="https://www.popularmechanics.com/science/a31156395/jeff-bezos-clock-long-now-mountain/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">10,000-year clock</a> in remote West Texas, and will certainly keep a close eye on Amazon as executive chairman. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/05/chinese-regulators-kick-didi-off-app-stores-stop-new-user-signups?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
China Cancels Didi's Ride
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last week, Chinese ride-hailing company Didi Chuxing went public in one of the largest US IPOs of the past decade. This weekend, Chinese regulators stopped new users from signing up and <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/07/05/technology/china-didi-crackdown.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ordered</a> its removal from app stores. Its stock has plunged more than 20% in pre-market trading.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s going on? </strong>Regulators think Didi’s trove of data could land in the wrong hands. A 2015 article making the rounds on Monday showed why that could be a problem: It analyzed how many Didi rides went to and from government departments in one day and estimated how much overtime their employees work. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Didi’s not the only one caught in Beijing’s dragnet. Yesterday, China’s Cyberspace Administration announced it was reviewing three other domestic companies (the parent companies of which recently listed shares in the US) and halted new user signups for their platforms. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> China has become <a href="https://apnews.com/article/china-data-privacy-technology-business-2728ec59a0ac887dd5a27a0cdd397b52?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">increasingly wary</a> of its tech giants and is starting to curb their power, which had gone largely unchecked until the past year. In April, the Chinese government blocked the IPO of the world’s largest fintech company, Ant Group, and <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/12/ant-group-forced-undergo-major-restructuring?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">forced</a> it to restructure.</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CYBERSECURITY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/05/russialinked-cybercrime-group-demands-70-million-ransom?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Biggest Ransomware Attack Ever
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Ron Swanson throws a computer in the dumpster" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=375 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/j4rPM934CLIvC/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Ron Swanson throws a computer in the dumpster" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/j4rPM934CLIvC/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This sounds like a sci-fi plot but it happened this weekend: A cybercrime organization claims to <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/technology-57719820?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">have infected</a> 1 million systems across 17 countries. Now, it’s demanding $70 million in bitcoin in exchange for a "universal decryptor" that will return users’ access. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Hackers <a href="https://www.latimes.com/world-nation/story/2021-07-05/scale-details-kaseya-ransomware-attack-emerge?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">targeted</a> the US IT firm Kaseya, then used that company’s software to slip into the victims’ systems, which they’re now holding hostage. They also appeared to time the attack for Fourth of July weekend intentionally, knowing US office workers would be OOO. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Most of the victims were public agencies and small businesses—like Swedish grocery chain Coop, which had to close most of its 800 stores all weekend. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">A worse sequel than <em>Anchorman 2</em>
</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This is the Russia-based REvil Group’s second widespread attack of the year. Last month, it extorted $11 million from meat supplier JBS after forcing it to <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/jbs-paid-11-million-to-resolve-ransomware-attack-11623280781?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shut down</a> its plants.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Biden has “directed the full resources of the government to investigate this incident” and suggested that the US is prepared to respond if it turns out the Russian government was involved.</p>

</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“The roar of his assault will sunder the dome of Heaven to reach the ears of God himself.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In one of the most <a href="https://twitter.com/Neal_Freyman/status/1411731008035201027?s=20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">epic sports intros</a> of all time, Major League Eating’s George Shea introduced competitive eater Joey Chestnut before Chestnut downed 76 hot dogs in 10 minutes at the Nathan’s Fourth of July Hot Dog Eating Contest. That topped his own record of 75 dogs last year. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Only 1.1% of Africa’s ~1.3 billion people are <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/delta-variants-spread-hobbles-global-efforts-to-lift-covid-19-restrictions-11625131968?mod=article_inline" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fully vaccinated</a>, and at least 21 of its 54 countries are experiencing Covid surges. The highly contagious Delta variant is causing fresh lockdowns and rising deaths in lower-income countries across the globe, including Indonesia, Bangladesh, and Uganda.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>Britney Spears’s conservatorship nightmare, by Ronan Farrow and Jia Tolentino. (<a href="https://www.newyorker.com/news/american-chronicles/britney-spears-conservatorship-nightmare?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">New Yorker</a>)</p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/05/short-week-ahead-july-6?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Short Week Ahead
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/05/short-week-ahead-july-6?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Sun Valley, ID" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NjY5L3N1bl92YWxsZXlfaWQuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Kevin Dietsch/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Sun Valley: </strong>After a one-year hiatus, Allen & Co.’s hyper-exclusive conference, aka the<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>“summer camp for billionaires,” <a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/07/05/1012587989/moguls-deals-and-patagonia-vests-a-look-inside-summer-camp-for-billionaires?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">returns</a> to the Sawtooth Mountains of Idaho this week with a guest list including Tim Cook, Mark Zuckerberg, and other people who don’t feel guilty with over-$40 DoorDash orders.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Economic data:</strong> In April, there were a record 9.3 million job openings in the US; we’ll find out on Wednesday whether employers were able to fill those positions in May. Also on Wednesday, the Fed will release the <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/07/02/fed-could-be-a-surprise-catalyst-for-markets-in-holiday-week-.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">minutes</a> from its June meeting. Investors will be looking for more details on the central bank’s plan to cut back its bond-buying ways. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">A sports bonanza: </strong>The Milwaukee Bucks and the Phoenix Suns tip off in Game 1 of the NBA Finals tonight. The semifinal matches for the Euros are today and tomorrow. The Stanley Cup finals are going to a Game 5. Wimbledon continues through this week. And the National Spelling Bee (def a sport) final will be televised Thursday after getting canceled last year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Everything else:</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>A </span><span><em>Gossip Girl </em></span><span>reboot comes to HBO Max on Thursday.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Marvel’s </span><span><em>Black Widow </em></span><span>arrives Friday.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Richard Branson will fly in a Virgin Galactic test flight to space on Sunday.</span></li>
</ul>

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Brew Mini: </strong>Another week, another spicy Mini puzzle for you to challenge your friends with. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/05/brew-mini?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Play it here</a>. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Decode the map</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What is unique about the population of the states shaded black? Hint: Yes, it has to do with agriculture. </p>

collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs of yesterday, Jeff Bezos is no longer the CEO of Amazon, the company he founded as an online book retailer in Seattle in 1994. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBezos left the CEO position as the richest person in the world, having amassed a $199 billion fortune. And though he just bought a $500+ million superyacht, all signs point to him not spending much time on it. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLet’s look at some of Bezos’s side hustles that could become main hustles.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSpace\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBezos’s interest in space \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2018/apr/25/jeff-bezos-the-boy-who-wanted-to-colonise-space?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edates back\u003c/a\u003e to his teenage days, when the high school valedictorian told the Miami Herald he wanted to “build space hotels, amusement parks, and colonies for 2 million or 3 million people who would be in orbit.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFast forward to 2000, when Bezos founded his rocket company Blue Origin two years before Elon Musk would start SpaceX. The amusement park idea may still be decades out, but the company has shorter-term ambitions in space tourism, satellite launches, and lunar landers. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn 2016, Bezos was spending \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/02/03/science/blue-origin-jeff-bezos.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eone day\u003c/a\u003e a week working at Blue Origin—expect that to jump.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003ePhilanthropy\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBezos has pledged $10 billion to climate-focused initiatives through the Bezos Earth Fund and gave $2 billion to increase access to education and address homelessness through the Bezos Day One Fund. But his philanthropic endeavors have been overshadowed by generous donations made by his ex-wife, \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/15/mackenzie-scott-donates-another-27b-bringing-total-almost-9b?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eMacKenzie Scott\u003c/a\u003e, and Bezos hasn’t signed the Giving Pledge, a commitment by the ultra-wealthy to give away at least half of their fortune.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe other stuff\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhen Mark Cuban sold his audio streaming company to Yahoo for $5.6 billion in 1999, he bought the NBA’s Dallas Mavericks the next year. Will Bezos also buy a sports team? Perhaps—he reportedly has \u003ca href=\"https://www.cbssports.com/nfl/news/amazon-founder-jeff-bezos-interested-in-owning-nfl-team-has-strong-support-among-current-owners/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexpressed interest\u003c/a\u003e in owning an NFL franchise.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhen he’s not busy with all of the above, Bezos owns the Washington Post, is building a \u003ca href=\"https://www.popularmechanics.com/science/a31156395/jeff-bezos-clock-long-now-mountain/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e10,000-year clock\u003c/a\u003e in remote West Texas, and will certainly keep a close eye on Amazon as executive style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLast week, Chinese ride-hailing company Didi Chuxing went public in one of the largest US IPOs of the past decade. This weekend, Chinese regulators stopped new users from signing up and \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/07/05/technology/china-didi-crackdown.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eordered\u003c/a\u003e its removal from app stores. Its stock has plunged more than 20% in pre-market trading.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’s going on? \u003c/strong\u003eRegulators think Didi’s trove of data could land in the wrong hands. A 2015 article making the rounds on Monday showed why that could be a problem: It analyzed how many Didi rides went to and from government departments in one day and estimated how much overtime their employees work. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDidi’s not the only one caught in Beijing’s dragnet. Yesterday, China’s Cyberspace Administration announced it was reviewing three other domestic companies (the parent companies of which recently listed shares in the US) and halted new user signups for their platforms. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e China has become \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/china-data-privacy-technology-business-2728ec59a0ac887dd5a27a0cdd397b52?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eincreasingly wary\u003c/a\u003e of its tech giants and is starting to curb their power, which had gone largely unchecked until the past year. In April, the Chinese government blocked the IPO of the world’s largest fintech company, Ant Group, and \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/12/ant-group-forced-undergo-major-restructuring?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eforced\u003c/a\u003e it to restructure.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis sounds like a sci-fi plot but it happened this weekend: A cybercrime organization claims to \u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/technology-57719820?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehave infected\u003c/a\u003e 1 million systems across 17 countries. Now, it’s demanding $70 million in bitcoin in exchange for a \"universal decryptor\" that will return users’ access. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHackers \u003ca href=\"https://www.latimes.com/world-nation/story/2021-07-05/scale-details-kaseya-ransomware-attack-emerge?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etargeted\u003c/a\u003e the US IT firm Kaseya, then used that company’s software to slip into the victims’ systems, which they’re now holding hostage. They also appeared to time the attack for Fourth of July weekend intentionally, knowing US office workers would be OOO. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMost of the victims were public agencies and small businesses—like Swedish grocery chain Coop, which had to close most of its 800 stores all weekend. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eA worse sequel than \u003cem\u003eAnchorman 2\u003c/em\u003e\n\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis is the Russia-based REvil Group’s second widespread attack of the year. Last month, it extorted $11 million from meat supplier JBS after forcing it to \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/jbs-paid-11-million-to-resolve-ransomware-attack-11623280781?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshut down\u003c/a\u003e its plants.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eBiden has “directed the full resources of the government to investigate this incident” and suggested that the US is prepared to respond if it turns out the Russian government was involved.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse:
